results.title: Val d'Herens: an alpine community in change
results.brief_description: A remote alpine community in Southern Switzerland is used as a case study to provide a background to the changing geographical characteristics which are common to many of the mountain areas of Western Europe. The traditional economic pattern is analysed, then recent modifications examined, notably improvement of access, the development of hydro-electric power potential and tourism.

results.title: Vagabond adventures: Moorish Spain
results.creator_credit: F Herrick, James W. Boring, RKO Radio Pictures and Van Beuren Corporation
results.brief_description: Descriptive film about Spain, the land of wine and other agricultural products. Southern Spain yields a rich harvest of grapes, raisins, wine and wheat. Andalusia in southern Spain gives way to age old ways of harvesting wheat. Goats produce milk for cheese and skins for wine bags. Oak trees are a wealth in southern Spain and cork is made from the bark. Another product is fine needlework. Also shows gypsies dancing in their camps. Narrated by Alois Havrilla.

results.title: Vaccines and vaccinations
results.brief_description: Several diseases of sheep may be prevented by vaccination. This film shows the care with which vaccines are made, the care with which they should be used and the correct procedures for administering them.

results.title: V.T.R. Rosedale
results.brief_description: This documentary was originally recorded on half-inch portable videotape and transferred to film. Rosedale, once referred to as “the rear end of Alberta” by one of its frustrated citizens, pulled itself together as a community. It formed a citizens’ action committee, cleaned up the town, built a park, and negotiated with the government to install gas, water and sewage systems. It all happened within five months. The catalyst of this development process was the use of VTR equipment by the citizens themselves.

results.title: V for volunteers
results.creator_credit: Leslie McFarlane, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The film tells the story of how a suburban housewife found new purpose and satisfaction through voluntary part-time neighborhood work. Drawn into voluntary service rather unwillingly, Janet Miller eventually finds a regular place in welfare work through the Central Volunteer Bureau. This is the start of a growing interest in community affairs. She and her husband learn of the work of volunteers in areas not covered entirely by professional social workers or welfare agencies. They initiate a successful citizens’ campaign to keep local youth centers open.

results.title: V for victory
results.brief_description: In this film, a publicity message for a war bond campaign, Norman McLaren draws symbols, a stick man, and lettering directly on clear 35mm film stock to synchronize with a brass band rendition of Sousa’s march The Thunderer.

results.title: Uterine cancer: the problem of early diagnosis
results.brief_description: Illustrates the practicability of drastically reducing deaths from cancer of the uterus by adherence in general office practice to the routine pelvic examination of all adult women.

results.title: Using them safely
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Drugs and Medicines”
Safely using either prescription or non-prescription drugs and medicines requires reading the label and following the directions, storing them in a safe place and avoiding leftover medicine

results.title: Using the Verifax printer type 1
results.brief_description: The use and maintenance of the Manual Verifax Printer Type 1. This visual “manual” highlights the simplicity of using a machine able to make multiple copies of a designated document. The simplistic approach to this manual is both economical and approachable to printing.
